result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 2:08 PM Defendant Najuan L C Brown appeared by video, in custody of JCI.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Najuan L C Brown.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance with victim rights. Defendant agrees and understands to appear remotely.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Bond set with no contact with victim.  PTC set for 10/5  and STC set for 11/9 @ 2:45PM via zoom.
